summary: This is a quitclaim deed filed in Palm Beach County, Florida, recording the transfer of a property from Jeffrey E. Epstein to Laurel, Inc. for $10. The document establishes Epstein's official residence/homestead as Little Saint James Island and includes notarization by Erika A. Kellerhals.

persons.name: Jeffrey E. Epstein
persons.context: Transfers a property in Palm Beach County, Florida, to Laurel, Inc. for $10. The document lists his address as being in St. Thomas, VI, and his homestead as Little Saint James Island.

persons.name: Erika A. Kellerhals
persons.context: Notarizes the quitclaim deed, confirming the identity of Jeffrey E. Epstein and witnessing the execution of the document in the U.S. Virgin Islands.

connections.description: Epstein transfers property to the corporation Laurel, Inc. via a quitclaim deed for $10.

events.title: Execution of Quitclaim Deed
events.description: Jeffrey E. Epstein executes a quitclaim deed transferring a property in Palm Beach County, Florida, to Laurel, Inc.

events.title: Recording of Quitclaim Deed
events.description: The quitclaim deed is recorded in Palm Beach County, Florida, under CFN 20120001716.

locations: 6100 Red Hook Quarter, Suite B-3, St. Thomas, VI 00802
PARCEL C, Little Saint James Island, No. 6A Red Hook Quarter, St. Thomas, VI 00802
9100 Havensight, f Sale, Ste 15-16, St. Thomas, VI 00802

Territory of the U.S. Virgin Islands, Division of St. Thomas/St. John
keyFacts: Jeffrey E. Epstein transferred a property in Palm Beach County, Florida, to the corporation Laurel, Inc. for only $10.
The document legally establishes Epstein's official residence and homestead address as Little Saint James Island in the U.S. Virgin Islands.
The transaction was notarized by Erika A. Kellerhals in the U.S. Virgin Islands on December 20, 2011.
The deed was recorded in Palm Beach County, Florida, on January 4, 2012.
The property transferred is described as a 0.07-acre parcel in El Bravo Park, Palm Beach County.
